parameters.name: CidrBlock
parameters.description:
The CIDR block of the vSwitch. Take note of the following limits:

*   The subnet mask of the CIDR block must be 16 to 29 bits in length.
*   The CIDR block of the vSwitch must fall within the CIDR block of the VPC to which the vSwitch belongs.
*   The CIDR block of a vSwitch cannot be the same as the destination CIDR block in a route entry of the VPC. However, it can be a subset of the destination CIDR block.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among all requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters.

>  If you do not specify this parameter, **ClientToken** is set to the value of **RequestId**. The value of **RequestId** may be different for each API request.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description:
The description of the vSwitch.

The description must be 1 to 256 characters in length and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
parameters.description: The last eight bits of the IPv6 CIDR block of the vSwitch. Valid values: **0** to **255**.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the vSwitch.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: VSwitchName
parameters.description:
The name of the vSwitch.

The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length, and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC where you want to create the vSwitch.

parameters.name: VpcIpv6CidrBlock
parameters.description: The IPv6 CIDR block of the VPC.

parameters.name: ZoneId
parameters.description:
The zone ID of the vSwitch.

You can call the [DescribeZones](~~36064~~) operation to query the most recent zone list.
